title: Love Thine Enemy
description: 'Hours of wonderful reading, well worth recommending' - READING PANEL In Paris in 1939, with the world on the brink of war, Helen Latimer, of a good English family, falls madly in love with Max, a handsome young German. When Helen becomes pregnant they plan to leave France for neutral Portugal, but Max is kidnapped by his brother Hermann's Nazi henchmen. Helen's brother, Charles, persuades her to return to England and Hermann convinces Max that she has had his child aborted. Max then marries Margrethe, the sister of Hermann's wife, and Helen marries Charles's friend, Roland. However, Helen and Max are destined to meet again...
author: Nora Fountain
